name: Oven Baked Chicken Breast
description: Recipe VIDEO above.Â My tips for a truly juicy, Oven Baked Chicken Breast: a touch of brown sugar in the seasoning which makes the chicken sweat while it bakes so it creates a semi "sauce", and cooking fast on a high temp! Go by the colour of the crust to know when it's cooked through.Â
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp dried oregano or thyme (, or other herb of choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Pound chicken to 1.5cm / 0.6" at the thickest part - using a rolling pin, meat mallet or even your fist (key tip for even cooking + tender chicken).
recipeInstructions.name: Pound chicken to 1.5cm / 0.6" at the thickest part - using a rolling pin, meat mallet or even your fist (key tip for even cooking + tender chicken).

recipeInstructions.text: Line tray with foil and baking / parchment paper. Place chicken upside down on tray. Drizzle chicken with about 1 tsp oil. Rub over with fingers. Sprinkle with Seasoning.
recipeInstructions.name: Line tray with foil and baking / parchment paper. Place chicken upside down on tray. Drizzle chicken with about 1 tsp oil. Rub over with fingers. Sprinkle with Seasoning.

recipeInstructions.text: Flip chicken. Drizzle with 1 tsp oil, rub with fingers, sprinkle with Seasoning, covering as much of the surface area as you can.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip chicken. Drizzle with 1 tsp oil, rub with fingers, sprinkle with Seasoning, covering as much of the surface area as you can.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake 18 minutes, or until surface is golden per photos and video, or internal temperature is 165Â°F/75Â°C using a meat thermometer.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake 18 minutes, or until surface is golden per photos and video, or internal temperature is 165Â°F/75Â°C using a meat thermometer.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and immediately transfer chicken to serving plates.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and immediately transfer chicken to serving plates.

recipeInstructions.text: Wait 3 - 5 minutes before serving, garnished with freshly chopped parsley if desired. Pictured with a side of Garlic Butter Rice with Kale.
recipeInstructions.name: Wait 3 - 5 minutes before serving, garnished with freshly chopped parsley if desired. Pictured with a side of Garlic Butter Rice with Kale.

review.reviewBody: Juicy and easy! Flavor was decent but I didnâ€™t feel it was anything special. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d go out of my way to make it again. Nagi has so many recipes that are AMAZING that now I canâ€™t settle for anything less in the old cookbook lol
This is the first time my chicken breast wasn't dry! I definate favourite.

It's my husband's birthday and I told him I'd make him any meal he desired or get takeout from his favorite restaurant.  He chose this chicken!  Lucky me!  It's the easiest thing on the planet to make. I'm a decent cook and make lots of complex recipes he really likes. This super simple chicken is one of his all-time favorites. Thanks for making it easy breezy here today!!
We use any leftovers to make CBLTA sandwiches with a sweet and spicy apricot sauce on kaiser rolls. So good!
My recipe binder is stuffed full of your recipes. I appreciate you so much!
PS...The homemade red curry paste as well as your char siu pork are the absolute best...my faves!!!

This is a real winner for a quick evening meal - fastest prep ever. I read the few mysterious comments about blandness and have figured it out.  The adult male in this house has a very boring palate, while I can eat whole green chilies.  So, I made two rubs.  One @ 50 per cent rub recipe sans paprika. Doubled rub quantities for the other breast. Served with your amazing garlic rice and green beans.  Delicious!

These turned out absolutely fabulous! I followed the recipe from the book which said to cook for 15 minutes until internal temp is 155Â°F. Instead, I cooked them for 18 minutes until they reached 165Â°F like this online recipe says. I was also out of garlic powder so I used onion instead. I always seem to have trouble cooking chicken breast but these were trouble free! It will definitely be a go-to for chicken breast now! Quick, easy and delicious. Thank you Nagi!

Easy and yummy chicken.

I want to try this with Turkey breast next time as I never know how to make it and I wonder if it will work this way...  ðŸ¤”
WOW! We make chicken about 3x a week; grilled, air fried and baked. This recipe was absolutely as advertised! So juicy and a great flavor. Big hit at our table and will DEFINITELY make it again!

My sister-in-law made this for us yesterday and everyone raved about how juicy the chicken was.  I think my husband said more than once "I've never had such tender, tasty chicken breasts."   Thank you, Nagi!

Made this for dinner tonight and it was a hit! The chicken was delicious and incredibly juicy! I just read a comment left by someone who said their chicken was bland. They must have not followed the recipe! Hands down one of the tastiest and perfectly seasoned chicken Iâ€™ve ever made! Delicious!!
It was pretty bland. I had two chicken breast that I cut in half horizontally and I liked the idea but wonâ€™t make this again. Too bad because it was super easy
MY FAVORITE RECIPE! I have used for years and passed on to friends and family! I use left overs in sandwhiches, salads, plain etc etc. so versatile and delicious!
These chicken breasts were delicious! Whipped them up quickly and they came out perfectly. Amazing recipe!

Good without being sensational but then that's the fault of chicken breast rather than the recipe. 
I had leftovers so reheated gently with a touch of chicken bone broth to keep them moist.
